p: Our sugarcane expansion scenario combined data from past expansion of sugarcane with an agro-environment zoning developed for the sugar and ethanol industry (AZA, http://www.ambiente.sp.gov.br). This zoning was created to minimize social and environment impacts of sugarcane [ 65] and to regulate the expansion of this crop within the state [ 66]. We considered that sugarcane expansion in each municipality will (i) occur in the same proportion to what occurred in the last ten years (2000â€“2010; i.e. we are considering a business as usual scenario), (ii) that this expansion will occur only in pasturelands, since this is the most common transition [ 54, 56, 67, 68], and (iii) the expansion will occur only in three zones considered as suitable for expansion according to the AZA ( S1 Fig).
